data.title: Division of Education
data.meta_description: The Division of Education’s goal is to graduate professionals prepared to model critical and creative thinking to improve the quality of life for students, their families, and the community.
data.text:
The Division of Education’s goal is to graduate professionals prepared to model critical and creative thinking to improve the quality of life for students, their families, and the community. The faculty and staff are committed to preparing outstanding educators who will become community leaders and model appreciation for diversity in the classroom.

Teacher Education Programs

The Division of Education offers Teacher Education licensure programs in Elementary Education (ELED, grades K-6) and a non-licensure program in Physical Education (PHED). Each program is built upon a sound liberal arts foundation and an appropriate content area foundation. Each program is also designed to enable candidates to acquire knowledge, skills, and dispositions that are crucial to effective teaching.

Division of Education

- BA in Physical Education

We offer a teaching endorsement in the following field, and it has been reviewed and accredited by CAEP:

- BS in Elementary Education K-6

All education majors interested in pursuing a Teacher Education Degree leading to licensure must meet Philander Smith University's graduation and Arkansas Licensure requirements.

Education Concentration

The Education Concentration is a pathway or a minor that allows students to complete their degree in an area below and pursue educational coursework that will fulfill their licensure to teach in Grades 7-12. Students who are interested in pursuing the Education Concentration option should speak with an advisor in the Division of Education.

- Biology

- Computer Science

- English
